raw_comment:
- I notice that legacy applicants with parents with lower incomes have about the same probability of getting accepted into an elite college as non-legacy applicants who have parents with much wealthier incomes.
- I wonder why the x-axis is skewed and how that affects the data. 
- I wonder why a legacy status has so much sway in these colleges.
- This relates to myself and my community because people around me are applying to colleges all the time, and there are several elite colleges close by that may be making biased decisions right now due to factors such as financial income and legacy status. I myself may even be applying to these colleges not too long from now!
- Headline: 
How Rigged the College Admissions Process Actually Is
